alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity; Southern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 12:41PM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Higher amounts above 4000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Trinity County including the higher summits on Hwy 3, 299 and 36. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Most of the snow will fall above 2,500 feet but up to 3 inches may fall as low as 1500 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
